column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=Today we know numerous methods of bonding foils together.
#Text=In particular, the following adhesives are used: waxes, thermoplastic adhesives, polymers, glues, dispersions, adhesive varnishes, and reactive adhesives.
#Text=The basic materials for the production of all these laminating adhesives, except some glues, are highly refined mineral oil derivates which are produced with a high expenditure of energy.
#Text=Waxes, thermoplastic adhesives, and polymers are applied molten and undiluted, the average quantity being 15 to 20 g/m.sup.2.
#Text=The adherency of the compounds is sensitive to water and relatively low.
#Text=Using glues and dispersions, the applied quantity of solids is about 2.5 g/m.sup.2, on an average.
#Text=These adhesives must be applied diluted, the mainly used thinner being water.
#Text=During the laminating process this water must be evaporated by application of process heat, thus heating the entire compound.
#Text=Thereafter the compound must quickly be cooled down.
#Text=It is true that with this method the consumption of adhesives is lower than with the methods mentioned before, but the toal amount of required process energy is considerably higher.
#Text=The adhesive power of the compound is high and more heat-resistant.
#Text=The method cannot be applied unless at least one of the materials to be laminated is highly permeable to steam.
#Text=So far the application of adhesive varnishes results in the highest adhesive power; it is possible to use adhesive varnishes with nearly all compound materials.
#Text=The mainly used adhesives are heat-reactive and dissolved in organic solvents.
#Text=The average consumption of adhesives is 12 g/m.sup.2, the quantity of solids being 4 g/m.sup.2 and the quantity of solvents being 8 g/m.sup.2.
#Text=These solvents must be evaporated by application of process heat.
#Text=In addition, they must be removed from the waste air for reasons of air pollution control.
#Text=Regarding the high energy consumption, the problems of air pollution, and the resulting higher costs of investment and operation, this method is very disadvantageous.
#Text=As for the adherency properties which can be achieved the reactive adhesives correspond to the adhesive varnishes, approximately.
#Text=At present, however, the universal application of such reactive adhesives is not yet possible as the methods are still in the phase of development and introduction.
#Text=The reactive adhesives are applied without using solvents and less than 2 g/m.sup.2 is needed.
#Text=Hereby the air pollution problems are solved and the energy consumption is largely reduced.
